xyz.swatt.asserts

Class ArgumentChecks

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.swatt.asserts.ArgumentChecks

  • public class ArgumentChecks
extends java.lang.Object
    Tests for method Arguments.

    If Test fails, it will throw an IllegalArgumentException!

                              java.lang.String _argumentName)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Check a given File to ensure that is it Exists.
        Parameters:
        _file - The File to Check.
        _argumentName - The Name of the Argument being checked. (Can be null or Empty String, to ignore.)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the File is null, Does Not Exist, or is a Folder.

      • pathIsAbsoluteFile

        public static java.nio.file.Path pathIsAbsoluteFile(java.lang.String _path,
                                                    java.lang.String _argumentName)
                                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks that a given Path is Absolute and points to a File, without looking at the file system.

        Note: Absolute does not take System into account. (So paths that start with "C:/" or "/" are both considered absolute.)

        Note: File check will return false negative, if it points to a file without an extension.

        Parameters:
        _path - The Path to Check.
        _argumentName - The Name of the Argument being checked. (Can be null or Empty String, to ignore.)
        Returns:
        A Path representing the given String.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the Path is null, Empty, Whitespace Only, not valid, not Absolute, or points to a Folder (not always caught).

      • pathIsAbsoluteFolder

        public static java.nio.file.Path pathIsAbsoluteFolder(java.lang.String _path,
                                                      java.lang.String _argumentName)
                                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks that a given Path is Absolute and points to a Folder, without looking at the file system.

        Note: Absolute does not take System into account. (So paths that start with "C:/" or "/" are both considered absolute.)

        Note: Folders with dots (.) in them, must end with a slash.

        Parameters:
        _path - The Path to Check.
        _argumentName - The Name of the Argument being checked. (Can be null or Empty String, to ignore.)
        Returns:
        A Path representing the given String.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the Path is null, Empty, Whitespace Only, not valid, not Absolute, or points to a File (not always caught).

        Check a given String to ensure that it is not Whitespace Only.
        Parameters:

        _argumentName - The Name of the Argument being checked. (Can be null or Empty String, to ignore.)
        Throws:
